newsitem.title: USA: TVA boosts output at 1,065 MW Ala. nuclear unit.
newsitem.headline: TVA boosts output at 1,065 MW Ala. nuclear unit.

text.p: TVA Nuclear's 1,065 megawatt (MW) Browns Ferry nuclear power unit 2 returned to service over the weekend from a repair outage which began Oct 29, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said.
The Decatur, Ala. plant was operating at 55 percent of capacity and increasing power as of early Monday morning, the NRC said in its daily plant status report.
The unit tripped off line after a problem with a generator backup relay.
The 1,065 megawatt Browns Ferry nuclear unit 3, also at Decatur, was operating at 100 percent of capacity as of early Monday, the NRC said.
A company spokesman was not immediately available for comment.
TVA Nuclear is a unit of the federal Tennessee Valley Authority.
